alert.note: Alert for Hart (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 09 at 5:43PM EST until January 10 at 9:19AM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Georgia, including the following counties, Elbert and Hart. * WHEN...Until 900 PM EST. * IMPACTS...River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 541 PM EST, Excessive runoff continues to work south through the Broad and Savannah River basins this evening. Lingering flooding of low-lying areas will become increasingly confined to areas near the Broad River and Beaverdam Creek. - Http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
